document.full_text: the commissioner's office and the players union said that players who played between 1947 and 1980 but not long enough to qualify for major league baseball's pension would receive annual payments of up to $10,000.
document.title: decades of players without pensions to get payments
lines_and_colors: the commissioner's office and the players union said that players who played between 1947 and 1980 but not long enough to qualify for major league baseball's pension would receive annual payments of up to $10,000.
